metadata.title: CVE-2021-20320 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in s390 eBPF JIT in bpf_jit_insn inarch/s390/net/bpf_jit_comp.c in the Linux kernel. In this flaw, a localattacker with special user privilege can circumvent the verifier and maylead to a confidentiality problem.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-20320` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-86-generic - 5.4.0-86.97
linux-image-5.4.0-86-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-86.97
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-86-generic - 5.4.0-86.97
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-86-lowlatency - 5.4.0-86.97
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1048-kvm - 5.4.0-1048.50
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-86.97').
linux-hwe-5.8: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-5.11, was needs-triage').
